channel.title: Criminal Couples
channel.description: History’s most infamous couples find a home in this special collection from Parcast Network. Every Monday, investigate the lovers that make up crime’s unholiest unions — from apocalyptic cult leaders and bank-robbing bandits to coupled kingpins, pirates, and spies. Listen free, only on Spotify.

item.title: Introducing: Malicious Moms
item.description: Hear an exclusive clip from the first episode of Parcast Network’s newest collection, just in time for Mother’s Day. Every Sunday, see how far some women went to help their kids… and how others used motherhood to get away with their misdeeds. From college admissions scandals to “self-defense” ax murders, motherhood’s no walk in the park — and in this series, it’s a minefield. Follow Malicious Moms and listen free, only on Spotify! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Sex Slave Killers: Gerald and Christine Gallego
item.description: By the time Gerald Gallego was 30, he was already a lifelong predator whose twisted crimes reached back into his childhood. When he met Charlene Williams in 1977, she became the newest target of his abuse — until she proposed a plan that made her his accomplice. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Serial Killers: Alton Coleman and Debra Brown
item.description: Following a whirlwind romance, Alton Coleman and Debra Brown embarked on a violent rampage that turned the summer of 1984 bloody. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Kidnappers: Wanda Barzee and Brian David Mitchell
item.description: All Wanda Barzee wanted in life was for someone to take care of her, and in return she promised complete devotion. So when her paramour, self-styled prophet Brian David Mitchell, demanded she help him find a child bride, Wanda aided and abetted the kidnapping of 14-year-old Elizabeth Smart. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Lonely Hearts Killers: Ray Fernandez and Martha Beck
item.description: Once a promising intelligence officer, Ray Fernandez transformed into a career conman, swindling lonely women out of their savings. When he met Martha Beck in 1947, his Lonely Hearts con became a deadly scheme of spiraling jealousies and stolen fortunes.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Black Widow & Her Lover: Celeste Beard and Tracey Tarlton
item.description: After her first marriages didn’t last, Celeste met someone who could finally offer stability: Texas millionaire Steve Beard. But their union was fraught from the beginning. Once Celeste found a confidant in Tracey Tarlton, she decided Steve had to go. And his life wouldn’t be the only one in danger. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Illicit Lovers: Sheila Garvie and Brian Tevendale
item.description: In 1960s Scotland, a husband’s insistence on building an unconventional life has deadly consequences after his wife falls in love with the 21-year-old man he pushed her to sleep with.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Deadly Affair: Harold and Ena Nokes
item.description: In a small town in Nebraska, Ena Nokes agreed to a menage-a-trois with her husband and his younger mistress, 29-year-old Kay Hoyt Hein. But when the affair soured, Harold Nokes began lashing out at Kay. And in 1974, he took his toxic obsession to deadly lengths.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Serial Killers: Ray and Faye Copeland
item.description: In 1989 a man dialed into a crime stoppers hotline to report his suspicions about an old employer. His call led police to a farm in Missouri, where Ray Copeland had been hiring farm hands to do his dirty work before killing them. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Prohibition Era Gangsters: Kathryn and "Machine Gun" Kelly
item.description: Kathryn Kelly was running schemes long before she ever met her notorious husband. She hungered to live a life of luxury and decadence. And she’d never apologize for those desires… Or for the things she did to make her dreams come true.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Killer High School Sweethearts: David Graham & Diane Zamora
item.description: After David Graham confessed to his high school sweetheart, Diane Zamora, that he'd cheated on her in 1995, she thought her life had been ruined. She convinced David the only way to make the pain go away would be to punish the girl who stole his heart. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Illicit Lovers: George Stoner & Alma Rattenbury
item.description: Late one evening in March 1935, Alma Rattenbury found her husband bludgeoned and barely alive in the drawing room of their Bournemouth, England home. As Francis Rattenbury’s life hung in the balance, three suspects came into focus — but one thing was clear. Somebody at 5 Manor Road was hiding a terrible secret.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Conspirators: Gypsy Rose Blanchard & Nicholas Godejohn
item.description: Dee Dee Blanchard seemed like the perfect mother to her terminally ill daughter, Gypsy Rose. But she hid a horrifying secret. By the time it came out in 2015, Dee Dee was dead, and Gypsy — who’d spent her lifetime relying on her mother’s care — was responsible.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Moors Murderers: Myra Hindley & Ian Brady
item.description: Falling hopelessly in love with her coworker in the 1960s, Myra Hindley molded herself to become an object of Ian Brady’s affection. Then she helped him kidnap and murder five children from across Manchester, England.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Killer Robbers: Karla Faye Tucker & Daniel Garrett
item.description: The brutal pickaxe murders of two near-strangers in June 1983 exposed a web of hostilities that investigators struggled to unravel. But once they did, they found the vengeful Karla Faye Tucker and her boyfriend Daniel Garrett at the center.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Kidnappers: Phillip & Nancy Garrido
item.description: In 1991, serial rapist Phillip Garrido and his wife Nancy kidnapped 11-year-old Jaycee Lee Dugard from her South Lake Tahoe neighborhood. They kept her in a backyard compound for eighteen horrific years, just hours from her home. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Pirates: Anne Bonny & Calico Jack
item.description: Sailing the high seas, looting ships across the Caribbean, Anne Bonny and Calico Jack became infamous during the Golden Age of Piracy in the early 1700s. But Calico Jack wasn’t the only pirate who changed Anne’s life forever…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Kingpins: Thelma & Jackie Wright
item.description: Over the course of nine years, Jackie Wright cheated on, abused, and left Thelma alone to raise their young son. But in 1986, their volatile relationship put her in a powerful position — at the top of a bicoastal drug empire. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Robbers: Celia & Ed Cooney
item.description: First they were newlyweds, living in Brooklyn in 1924. Then, they were outlaws — the Bobbed-Haired Bandit and her handsome accomplice. Becoming armed robbers had been Ed’s plan… But it was the gun-toting, cop-taunting Celia who would become its avatar.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Black Widow & The Mountain Man: Sharon Lynn Nelson & Gary Adams
item.description: After a chance meeting in 1982, Gary Adams was in the thrall of Sharon Lynn Nelson — a serial adulterer whose brazen affairs scandalized her small Colorado town. Before long, they weren’t just breaking marriage vows. They were plotting to kill. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Witch Killers: Michael & Suzan Carson
item.description: In the late 1970s, Michael and Suzan embarked on a whirlwind romance fueled by hallucinogens and religious fanaticism. They set out to ignite a holy war with feverish conviction, murdering people they accused of being witches to rid the world of evildoers. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Spies: Julius & Ethel Rosenberg
item.description: The Rosenbergs spent the 1940s creating a spy network that passed U.S. government intel to the Soviet Union. From the time they met at a political rally to when they faced capital punishment on espionage charges, Julius and Ethel remained devoted to their cause, and each other. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ken and Barbie Killers: Karla Homolka & Paul Bernardo
item.description: By the time Karla met Paul in 1987, he was already a seasoned rapist. Instead of being turned off by his sadistic aggressions, Karla went along with them. Together, the Canadian couple raped and killed three minors in the early 1990s — starting with Karla’s own sister. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Skyjackers: Cathy Kerkow & Willie Holder
item.description: After an unexpected reunion in 1972, Willie Holder and Cathy Kerkow hatched an audacious plan. The self-styled revolutionaries hijacked a plane, then fled the country to start new lives abroad. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: House of Horrors: Fred & Rosemary West
item.description: In the 1970s and ‘80s, married serial killers Fred and Rosemary West tortured and killed a dozen young girls and women in their home in Gloucester, England. Among those victims were their own children. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Cult Leaders: Susan & Tony Alamo
item.description: In 1960s Los Angeles, Susan Fleetwood and Tony Alamo each dreamed of breaking into the entertainment industry. They met by chance, married, and began a different path toward fame and fortune: building a multi-million dollar machine of exploitation and abuse, disguised as an apocalyptic ministry. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Bandits: Bonnie Parker & Clyde Barrow
item.description: It’s been nearly 90 years since Bonnie and Clyde died in a police ambush following a years-long crime spree across the Midwest. With Hollywood's help, the Depression-era outlaws have become icons of love and rebellion… But their real story has far more grime than glamor. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Welcome to Criminal Couples
item.description: Some couples go down in history for the most sinister reasons… Over the next 14 weeks, get an intimate look at the most dangerous duos ever featured across Parcast Network. Every Monday, Criminal Couples introduces you to two new partners in crime, uncovering the twists of fate that brought them together, and the true stories behind the lawless lives they led. Criminal Couples premieres February 1st, with 2-part episodes airing every Monday. Listen free, only on Spotify.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
